By James Clay

Nouse sits down with nightclub photographer and University of York student Felix Wahlberg.

YUSU celebrates and recognises the voluntary work of students across York

By James Clay

Student volunteers acknowledged during Student Volunteering Week 2023

Local Plan for York under consideration

By James Clay

Plans for future investment in housing and infrastructure are being debated by the local council

UCU strikes stood down

By Gracie Daw

Action on 21, 22, 23, 27, 28 February and 1 and 2 March will not go ahead

YUSU Election Results 2023

By James Clay

Pierrick Roger re-elected as YUSU President

YUSU Election Results 2023

By James Clay

Pierrick Roger re-elected as YUSU President

Visa controversy affects Philosophy PhD student

A PhD student with teaching responsibilities in the University's Philosophy Department, has been forced to leave the country half-way through term due to visa issues

Greens Launch 10:1 Campaign

The University of York Green Party have launched a new campaign on campus aiming to cut excessive university pay

Roses marred by organisational disorder

Roses may have proved a successful sporting spectacle once again, but the tournament was also marred by several organisational failures by Lancaster (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Aggie Torrance)

Students voice support for LGBT campaign

Over 250 signatures were collected in two hours for a petition supporting consultation for equal marriage for same-sex couples last Thursday

York drops two places in University league table

The University of York has dropped two places in the Guardian's 2013 University league table (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Hong Yong Lim)

Celebrate York: In pictures

Pictures from the Celebrate York event held in Hull Road Park on Saturday

Roses 2012: Sunday as it happened

Join the Nouse Sport team for live scores, commentary, and match reports throughout the day

Roses 2012: Friday as it happened

Join the Nouse Sport team live as the first full day of action unfolds in Lancaster. Scores, commentary, and match reports

University Vice-Chancellor to step down

EXCLUSIVE: Brian Cantor, the University of York Vice-Chancellor, is to step down at the end of the 2012/13 academic year. Cantor has been in the position since 2002. (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: George Lowther)

YUSU Accounts: where does your money go?

As the National Union of Students calls on universities to "come clean" and students' unions, make their financial statements easily available online, Nouse can reveal what YUSU spends its, and your, money on

A wealth of history

On Saturday 12th May, the University of York and York St John University, are holding an inaugural 'Celebrate York' event, in a bid to encourage the local community to celebrate their heritage (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Simon Grubb)

'Edible Uni' to offer students free home-grown produce on campus

A new environmental project, 'Edible Uni', is set to grow vegetables on campus which students will be able to access for free (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Andy Davies)

English students unhappy with workshops

First-year English students are criticising the introduction of this term's workshops (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Dave &amp; Bry)

Five feature films planned

The University's Department of Theatre, Film and Television are celebrating a collaboration with a production company and will help with the creation of five feature films to be aired from the end of this year onwards (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Heslington Studios)

STYC contract introduced across campus

Selective procedures for the appointment of colleges STYCs are to be introduced, starting next year (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Philippa Grafton)

University's female scientists recognised

Psychology, Physics, and Computer Science departments have each received recognition from the Athena SWAN Charter, in recognition of their support for women in science

YUSU warned University over choice of contractors

YUSU have spoken out over the chaotic building of the new Student Centre, after YUSU issued a warning to the University about the financial situation of Killby & Gayford, who went into administration two weeks ago (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Semire Yekta)

New 24 hour library opening hours provokes mixed response

The new 24/7 opening times for the University library have been used extensively by students in the first two weeks of opening

University maintains league table ranking

The University has retained its place in the Complete University Guide's rankings, once again ranking 12th out of a total 116 universities in the UK

University donations could drop by PS1m under charity tax cap

Donations to the University could fall by up to PS1m each year due to the new charity tax cap proposed by the government, according to figures obtained by Nouse (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Matt Grum)

V-Bar delay confirmed for August 2013

The renovation of Vanbrugh's bar has now been confirmed to have been delayed until August 2013 (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Philippa Grafton)

James catered students "dissatisfied"

Students living in catered accommodation in James College are dissatisfied with several aspects of the service they are receiving, a Customer Satisfaction Survey has shown (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Aggie Torrance)

University Radio York played on 'Campus Hopper' Bus

University radio York is now being played on the free 'Campus Hopper' bus running between Heslington East and West campuses. The station went live on the Buses yesterday

NUS National Conference: live video

The NUS National Conference comes from Sheffield this year and you can watch the whole event live over the three days

YSTV clinch top honour

The National Student Television Awards at the weekend saw YSTV pick up the award of Best Broadcaster

Contractors for new YUSU Student Centre fall into administration

Building work on the new YUSU Student Centre is temporarily suspended after the Principal Contractor, Killby & Gayford, fell into administration last week (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Andy Davis)

The Gallery nightclub's future is saved

A review of nightclub The Gallery's licence has been withdrawn following assurances by its owners to address alcohol-related problems in the club (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Lucy Dixon)

Universities to set exams in planned A-level reform

Changes put forward by Michael Gove, the Education Secretary, in the way A Levels are set could see universities setting A-level exams (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: albertogp123)

Devolution for Yorkshire proposed

York's City Council leader, James Alexander, has proposed that Yorkshire should be given "Scottish-style devolution" because of its geographical size and large economy. This would be a regional assembly which would gain control of certain powers from the UK Government. (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: brianpettinger)

Tens of thousands spent honouring "worthy" figures

It has emerged that the University spends thousands of pounds on entertaining public figures and awarding them honorary degrees. Over the last four years, PS40,000 has been spent on associated costs (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Georgi Mabee)

Visa controversy affects Philosophy PhD student

A PhD student with teaching responsibilities in the University's Philosophy Department, has been forced to leave the country half-way through term due to visa issues

Greens Launch 10:1 Campaign

The University of York Green Party have launched a new campaign on campus aiming to cut excessive university pay

Roses may have proved a successful sporting spectacle once again, but the tournament was also marred by several organisational failures by Lancaster (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Aggie Torrance)
